org.thegalactic.rule

Class AssociationRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.thegalactic.rule.Rule
      • org.thegalactic.rule.AssociationRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Rule>

    public class AssociationRule
extends Rule

    This class gives a representation for an association rule.

    A rule is composed of a premise and a conclusion that are comparable sets, i.e. sets of elements that can be sorted by the lectic order defined by class ComparableSet. An association rule extends regular rule with the notion of support and confidence. The confidence represents the number of observations for which the rule is true. The support represents the minimum number of observations for the rule to be relevant.

    To Do#1

    do we use composition over inheritance?
